body: It seems that with or without a transmittance schedule the effect of a horizontal shading surface (HB context surface) on the cooling loads of a room is the same. This is how I define a transmittance schedule for a HB context surface: [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/*VTYACbMdusextZZSz8ndxw0JYdixlZXxZ0DEYgqRbdY*0yPQLQUnQzGVMdcvTrYFvjyLeErVrfN1QSwklmsmywW1yfiSmWe/Image42.png) Isn't that a shading surface with relatively higher transmittance value, e.g a much porous or transparent surface, will have less shading effect, resulting in higher cooling loads, as compared to one with lower transmittance (less porous or less transparent)? Appreciate your advice.
topic: [unable to reproduce issue] transmittance schedule of shading surface doesn't affect cooling loads
